author: bridge-bot
content:
<eliastzr> Hi, question about pre-eip155 transactions, how do other rollups handle them?

I saw https://docs.scroll.io/en/technology/chain/transactions/ for scroll

We’re debating enabling pre-eip155 txs on Kakarot to allow people to replay txs to deploy universal deployers contracts

author: bridge-bot
content: <eliastzr> How would you allow deployment of forge deterministic deployer (re @Gregthegreek: I highly advise against this)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Gregthegreek> It opens up too many potential griefing issues back to eth mainnet

author: bridge-bot
content: <Gregthegreek> and with everyone deploying 4337 wallets with the same address it opens up the possibility of actual malicious txs being replayed.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Gregthegreek> This is why Geth explicitly blocks pre-155 in the mempool, its to protect mainnet

author: bridge-bot
content: <Gregthegreek> Not overly familiar with the underlying implementation (re @eliastzr: How would you allow deployment of forge deterministic deployer)

author: bridge-bot
content: <eliastzr> How did other rollups deploy the singleton factory though

author: bridge-bot
content:
<drortirosh> Dont open it for the public: allow a single transaction, to deploy the "deterministic deployer" by arachnid. Once a deployer is deployed, it is usable by anyone.
(that's the same in Ethereum and Polygon, for example: the deployer was deployed before EIP-155 came into effect, but it is still perfectly usable today) (re @eliastzr: Hi, question about pre-eip155 transactions, how do other rollups handle them?

I saw https://docs.scroll.io/en/technology/chain/transactions/ for scroll

We’re debating enabling pre-eip155 txs on Kakarot to allow people to replay txs to deploy universal deployers contracts)

author: bridge-bot
content: <eliastzr> Ok! We may want to do permissioned pre-eip155 then!

author: bridge-bot
content:
